intro: Thesium apiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Thesium apiculatum is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
